title: 'Life-changing' pomegranate cutting hack is blowing people's minds

This year has seen a number of food-related hack videos go viral on social media, showing us how to 'correctly' peel and chop things.

There was the pineapple one and who could forget the one all about garlic.

And now there's another to add to the list - and it's blowing people's minds.

A video of someone slicing up a pomegranate has had almost three million views and been shared hundreds of thousands of times on Twitter .

The pomegranate is still attached to the tree as it is cut, and is seemingly effortlessly sliced into six perfect, juicy segments.

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

The fascinating clip was uploaded by an account called @engineeringvids.

Many people praised the hack, calling it "amazing" and "genius".

One user wrote: "This is life changing! Thanks!"

Another said: "Wow!!!! Simply Wow!"

However not everyone was convinced the cutting method would actually work in real life - as some of the previous hacks had failed.

They were also suspicious about the lack of pomegranate juice on the person's hands, leading them to wonder if the video was fake.

So some people decided to give it a go for themselves.

Comedian Dana Goldberg said she had tried it and it worked for her.

Social Media Strategist Josh Billinson added: "It does but I’m lazy so I’ll just cut it however and then break it apart submerged in a bowl of water to separate the seeds from the flesh super easily."

Author Cassie St.Onge added that it was not "as easy as it looks, but not a bad method".
description: According to a viral video on social media we've all be slicing and cutting pomegranates wrong
